channel.title: Bias on OSINTEL Project
channel.description: Recent content in Bias on OSINTEL Project

item.title: Sourcing Philosophy
item.description: Philosophy and Disclaimer One of the intentions of this site is to merge sources from academia, Think Tanks, and journalists. In my estimation this is where OSINT is lacking. Typically I think of as OSINT as more for the cybersecurity nerd worried about exploitations of zero days and cyber ops. Much of that is done via Twitter analytics by looking at various topics and motioring their web traffic. That’s all well and good if you like that stuff but I believe this provides a skewed understanding of a topic.

item.title: How to View a Source
item.description: Rules of Thumb: Every source is suspect. No source will ever be completely factually correct no matter who its author. A great deal of skepticism is needed when analyzing and evaluating new information. What is the publishing history of the author of the source? What is the motive to release or publish this source? What platform is this source on? Are the sources named or unnamed? What does the bibliography look like?
